intro: Diplostephium denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and have serrated edges, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
